data.title: Historic Port Conway, King George County
data.meta_description: This Virginia Department of Historic Resources highway marker #J-66 is located in King George County 22485 on James Madison Parkway (Route 301), one-quarter mile south of Kings Highway (Route 3). The inscription reads: "HISTORIC PORT CONWAY The site of Port Conway is located five miles south on the Rappahannock River. Francis Conway laid out the town in 1783. Brig. Gen. H. Judson Kilpatrick's Federal cavalry shelled two Union gunboats at Port Conway that had been captured by Confederates. John Wilkes Booth, the assassin of President Abraham Lincoln, fled across the river there on 24 Apr. 1865. Little remains of the town today." Courtesy of Dwayne and Maryanne Moyers, Realtors in Caroline County, King George County, Spotsylvania County, and Stafford County. Visit us at www.TheMoyersTeam.com
data.text:
This Virginia Department of Historic Resources highway marker #J-66 is located in King George County 22485 on James Madison Parkway (Route 301), one-quarter mile south of Kings Highway (Route 3). The inscription reads: "HISTORIC PORT CONWAY The site of Port Conway is located five miles south on the Rappahannock River. Francis Conway laid out the town in 1783. Brig. Gen. H. Judson Kilpatrick's Federal cavalry shelled two Union gunboats at Port Conway that had been captured by Confederates. John Wilkes Booth, the assassin of President Abraham Lincoln, fled across the river there on 24 Apr. 1865. Little remains of the town today."

Courtesy of Dwayne and Maryanne Moyers, Realtors in Caroline County, King George County, Spotsylvania County, and Stafford County. Visit us at www.TheMoyersTeam.com
